edu.cuny.ai.learning
Class EpsilonGreedyLearner

java.lang.Object
  edu.cuny.ai.learning.AbstractLearner
      edu.cuny.ai.learning.EpsilonGreedyLearner
All Implemented Interfaces:
DiscreteLearner, ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, Learner, StimuliResponseLearner, Parameterizable, Prototypeable, Resetable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
EpsilonGreedyLearnerWithDiscount
public class EpsilonGreedyLearner
extends AbstractLearner
implements ExposedStimuliResponseLearner, java.io.Serializable, Prototypeable

This is deprecated. Please use NArmedBanditLearner with EpsilonGreedyActionChoosingPolicy and AdaptiveReturnUpdatingPolicy (with AveragingLearner) instead. It is moved from the source and left here for test purposes.

A learner that implements the epsilon-greedy algorithm for n-armed bandit problem described in Section 2.2, Sutton and Barto's RL book.

epsilon is constant when alpha is 1, or reducing down to minepsilon when alpha is less than 1.

Parameters

base.k
int >=1		 (number of actions)
base.epsilon
double (0,1) (0.1 by default)		 (the probability that the actions except the best action are randomly chosen)
base.minepsilon
double >=0		 (the minimum value for epsilon)
base.alpha
double (0, 1]		 (the reducing rate of epsilon over time)

Default Base

epsilon_greedy_learner

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Jinzhong Niu
See Also:
